fallbackToID: Use the trans-unit id attribute for the text unit name if there is no resname
ignoreInputSegmentation: Ignore the segmentation information in the input
alwaysUseSegSource:
Always use the content of seg-source even if there are differences between
source
addTargetLanguage: Add the target-language attribute if not present
overrideTargetLanguage: Override the target language of the XLIFF document
allowEmptyTargets: Allow empty <target> elements in XLIFF document
skipNoMrkSegSource: Skip seg-sources with no marked segments
outputSegmentationType0: Segment only if the input text unit is segmented
outputSegmentationType1: Always segment (even if the input text unit is not segmented)
outputSegmentationType2: Never segment (even if the input text unit is segmented)
outputSegmentationType3: Segment only if the entry is segmented and regardless how the input was
useCustomParser: Use a custom XML stream parser
factoryClass: Factory class for the custom XML stream parser
useTranslationTargetState: Update the state attribute value of the translated XLIFF
alwaysAddTargets: Add <target> elements when XLIFF document is monolingual
forceUniqueIds: Rewrite TU IDs to enforce uniqueness, when necessary
iwsBlockLockStatus:
Set Finished Segments with the lock_status="locked" attribute as
translate="no"
iwsBlockTmScore: Set Segments with the matching tm_score attribute value as translate="no"
iwsBlockTmScoreValue: Value of the tm_score to match
iwsIncludeMultipleExact:
Include Segments with the multiple_exact="has_multiple_exact" attribute
regardless of their tm_score
iwsBlockMultipleExact:
Set Finished Segments with the multiple_exact="has_multiple_exact"
attribute as translate="no"
cdataSubfilter:
Process CDATA content with this sub-filter
(e.g. "okf_html"; leave blank to disable)
pcdataSubfilter:
Process PCDATA content with this sub-filter
(leave blank to disable)
